docs.snippet: Wright State University in Ohio said on Tuesday it had decided not to host the first U.S. presidential debate scheduled for Sept. 26, citing mounting costs and security concerns, and the event will now be held at Hofstra University in New York....
docs.lead_paragraph: Wright State University in Ohio said on Tuesday it had decided not to host the first U.S. presidential debate scheduled for Sept. 26, citing mounting costs and security concerns, and the event will now be held at Hofstra University in New York.

headline.main: Ohio College Pulls Out of U.S. Presidential Debate, Citing Security
headline.print_headline: Ohio College Pulls Out of U.S. Presidential Debate, Citing Security

docs.snippet: The president’s address was a shift in tone from previous talks intended to console the nation....
docs.lead_paragraph: The president’s address was a shift in tone from previous talks intended to console the nation.
docs.abstract: News Analysis; Pres Obama's terse statement after killing of three Baton Rouge police officers, in which he noted that racially tinged violence across country has permanently reshaped presidency, seems directed at his successor.

headline.main: In Aftermath of Baton Rouge Shooting, Obama Directs Message to His Successor
headline.print_headline: In Aftermath of Another Shooting, Obama Directs Message to His Successor

docs.snippet: Thirteen months after launching an improbable bid for the White House, Donald Trump captured the 2016 Republican presidential nomination on Tuesday, having vanquished 16 party rivals, warred with much of its establishment and provoked controversy ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Thirteen months after launching an improbable bid for the White House, Donald Trump captured the 2016 Republican presidential nomination on Tuesday, having vanquished 16 party rivals, warred with much of its establishment and provoked controversy at every turn.

headline.main: Beating Rivals and the Odds, Trump Captures Republican Nomination
headline.print_headline: Beating Rivals and the Odds, Trump Captures Republican Nomination

docs.snippet: Cementing an extraordinary political takeover, Republicans nominated Donald Trump Tuesday night as their presidential standard-bearer, hitching their hopes of keeping Democrat Hillary Clinton out of the White House on an unorthodox candidate who h...
docs.lead_paragraph: Cementing an extraordinary political takeover, Republicans nominated Donald Trump Tuesday night as their presidential standard-bearer, hitching their hopes of keeping Democrat Hillary Clinton out of the White House on an unorthodox candidate who has sown divisions within the party and across the nation.

headline.main: Trump Triumphs as GOP Nominee, Completing Stunning Climb
headline.print_headline: Trump Triumphs as GOP Nominee, Completing Stunning Climb

docs.snippet: Donald Trump's voters adored him for mostly paying his own way in the first half of the presidential campaign. Yet those same people are shrugging their shoulders now that he's raising money just like the rivals he once disparaged as the "puppets"...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump's voters adored him for mostly paying his own way in the first half of the presidential campaign. Yet those same people are shrugging their shoulders now that he's raising money just like the rivals he once disparaged as the "puppets" of big donors.

headline.main: Poll: Trump Supporters Unfazed by Reversal on Self-Funding
headline.print_headline: Poll: Trump Supporters Unfazed by Reversal on Self-Funding

docs.snippet: An Ohio university cited rising security worries and costs Tuesday as it withdrew as host of the first presidential general election debate, which will move to New York's Hofstra University....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Ohio university cited rising security worries and costs Tuesday as it withdrew as host of the first presidential general election debate, which will move to New York's Hofstra University.

headline.main: New York to Host 1st Presidential Debate After Ohio Bows Out
headline.print_headline: New York to Host 1st Presidential Debate After Ohio Bows Out

docs.snippet: If he wins the presidency, Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump would seek to purge the federal government of officials appointed by Democratic President Barack Obama and could ask Congress to pass legislation making it easier to fire publ...
docs.lead_paragraph: If he wins the presidency, Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump would seek to purge the federal government of officials appointed by Democratic President Barack Obama and could ask Congress to pass legislation making it easier to fire public workers, Trump ally, Chris Christie, said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Exclusive: Trump Could Seek New Law to Purge Government of Obama Appointees
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Trump Could Seek New Law to Purge Government of Obama Appointees
